disease: Squamous cell carcinoma of skin of left upper limb, including shoulder

symptoms.name: Sore or scab that doesn't heal in about two months
Flat patch of scaly skin that won't go away
Painless lump in the neck (if lymph nodes are involved)
Tender, raised, or higher than the surrounding skin

risk_factors: Excessive ultraviolet (UV) radiation exposure (sunlight, tanning beds)
Low levels of melanin in the skin
Blond or red hair, light-colored eyes, freckles, sunburn easily
Occupational and environmental exposure to radiation, arsenic and polycystic hydrocarbons

imaging_findings.MRI: Extensive involvement of the second and third metacarpals and interossei which extended volarly

required: Histological confirmation of squamous cell carcinoma
